H0.text: Through exposure to air is how nutrients get into soil.

H1.text: By absorbing sunlight is the best explanation for how nutrients get into soil.

H2.text: Through decaying matter, nutrients get into soil, which best explains how nutrients enter the soil.

H3.text: By rocks eroding is how nutrients get into soil.

A4.text: Under these conditions, many bacterial cells burst, releasing a pulse of nutrients.

A5.text: The CDI surrounding the carcass will display an increase in soil carbon and nutrients such as phosphorus, potassium, calcium and magnesium
